@nobadreply we already have supply and demand issues with our energy here, and there have been reports released by some of the top electrical infrastructure engineers in the province here that just three EV’s trying to charge at the same time on one street could overload the grid and cause a blackout for the entire block. Early government estimates at the cost of upgrading to “green” infrastructure at $99Billion, not including “other incidental costs” ????

@sinewheel I just bought a 2021 Canyon AT4 last year, I don’t really want an EV as the range is impractical for most of the work I do, but Trudope is doing a double fuel tax increase this year, adding another $.25/Litre in taxes to our gas, the current price of which already includes $.68/Litre in taxes depending on where you live ????????? Higher fuel costs also drive up the cost of all consumer goods as it costs more to get them to stores etc. and those increased costs won’t be absorbed but passed on to the end user of the goods. ??  So at some point switching to something like a Rivian will be the best short-term solution. But we’re just fighting the clock here, against a national leadership group who’s end goal is socialism, “you will own nothing and you will be happy” well you won’t be happy but voicing unhappiness will be banned and censored (Bill C11 is the first step on that path)
